did.unittitle: William Mott inventory of goods and chattels
did.abstract: Inventory of the goods and chattels of the deceased William Mott, merchant, conducted by Isaac Wright and Isaac Doty on January 14, 1796.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William Mott inventory of goods and chattels, 1977.485, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inventory of the goods and chattels of the deceased William Mott, merchant, conducted by Isaac Wright and Isaac Doty on January 14, 1796. The inventory does not state where Mott resided, but as Isaac Doty was a resident of New York City, it is likely that Mott resided or at least worked in New York City as well.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.This item is in the public domain.
